creators.affiliation: Data Science and Management & Cluster of Excellence on Plant Sciences (CEPLAS), University of Cologne, Cologne, Germany
creators.name: Schrader, Andrea

description: This repository documents the training following the github-without-command-line (Coderefinery contributors) doi-exercise to publish a GitHub repository with a persistent identifier (doi) using the Zenodo sandbox instance in order to prepare for future Zenodo submissions and making selected GitHub repositories citable. Beyond this, also, two files for citation (and other) relevant metadata are explored with respect to the Zenodo submission process (CITATION.cff and .zenodo.json). Experienced obstacles were documented and working examples were created for this repository. Role - Academic Expert in Data Science for CEPLAS at University of Cologne. CEPLAS, Cluster of Excellence on Plant Sciences, is funded by the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (DFG, German Research Foundation) under Germany's Excellence Strategy, EXC-2048/1
notes: If you use content of this repository, please cite it using these metadata and visit the README of the andreaschrader/doi-exercise repository or the scope provided for the references in the CITATION.cff file to learn how the references were used.
references: Druskat, S., Spaaks, J. H., Chue Hong, N., Haines, R., Baker, J., Bliven, S., Willighagen, E., Pérez-Suárez, D., & Konovalov, A. (2021). Citation File Format (1.2.0). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5171937. Accessed 03. Jan. 2024
European Organization For Nuclear Research and OpenAIRE, Zenodo, en, 2013. DOI: 10.25495/7GXK-RD71. [Online]. Available: https://www.zenodo.org/.

European Organization For Nuclear Research and OpenAIRE, 'zenodo (GitHub repository)' 2013 [Online]. Available: https://github.com/zenodo/zenodo. Used file: https://github.com/zenodo/zenodo/blob/master/zenodo/modules/deposit/static/json/zenodo_deposit/deposit_form.json. Accessed 03. Jan. 2024

Sparks J. H. 'zendodraft/metadata-schema-zenodo (GitHub repository)' 2022 [Online]. Available: https://github.com/zenodraft/metadata-schema-zenodo. Used files: README.md and schema.json. Accessed 03. Jan. 2024
title: andreaschrader/doi-exercise
